section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Owner-occupied residential property" means the principal residence of a homeowner as defined in § 9-105 of this article.

"Business property" means real property:
that has been assigned a commercial use code by the Department; and
for which the total State, county, municipal corporation, and special taxing district property taxes for the taxable year do not exceed $100,000.

text.section:
Notwithstanding Subtitle 1 of this title:
the governing body of a county shall provide a semiannual payment schedule for State, county, and special taxing district property taxes due on owner-occupied residential property or business property; and
the governing body of a municipal corporation shall provide a semiannual payment schedule for municipal corporation and special taxing district property taxes due on owner-occupied residential property or business property.

A semiannual payment schedule under this section shall apply:
at the time of the transfer of property purchased on or after July 1, 2000; and
to any current or future owner of owner-occupied residential property or business property, regardless of whether the property was purchased before July 1, 2000.

section.section:
The semiannual payment schedule under this section shall apply to:
the property tax due for the tax year following transfer of the property; and
the property tax due and not in arrears for the current tax year for any transfer occurring on or after July 1 but on or before September 30.
The first installment of a semiannual payment shall be paid on or before September 30.

text.section: A semiannual payment schedule may include a service charge to be paid with the second installment.

The local taxing authority shall provide to the Department by May 1 of each year, information that substantiates that the proposed service charge for the anticipated lost interest is reasonably equivalent to the amount of interest that will be lost as a result of the semiannual payment.

section.section:
The Department shall approve any local semiannual payment schedule collection that:
provides efficient and cost-effective collection of taxes; and
provides two semiannual coupons, two semiannual billing forms, or a similar method that allows taxpayers to pay on a semiannual basis.
Local semiannual payment schedule collection systems that are not approved by the Department shall utilize 2 semiannual payment coupons that shall be submitted with the appropriate payment.

If an escrow account is established for the payment of the property tax, the escrow account servicer shall pay tax in semiannual installments unless the escrow account servicer has received written direction from the property owner or borrower to pay property tax in annual payments.

If a taxpayer provides written direction to an escrow account servicer at least 60 days prior to the beginning of the tax year, property taxes shall be paid on an annual payment basis on behalf of that taxpayer by the escrow account servicer in the tax year that begins immediately following the year in which the written direction was received.

If a taxpayer provides written direction to an escrow account servicer less than 60 days prior to the beginning of the tax year, property taxes may be paid on an annual payment basis on behalf of that taxpayer by the escrow account servicer in the tax year that begins immediately following the year in which the written direction was received.

The governing body of Prince George's County may authorize, by law, an installment payment schedule of no more than six payments each year for county, municipal, and special taxing district property taxes due on owner-occupied residential property owned by a homeowner if:
the homeowner is at least 62 years old; and
the owner-occupied residential property is not subject to a deed of trust, mortgage, or other encumbrance.
